name: Drass et al. v. Tall Cedars Marina, Inc. et al., Appellants
name_abbreviation: Drass v. Tall Cedars Marina, Inc.

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeeoy, JJ.
parties: Drass et al. v. Tall Cedars Marina, Inc. et al., Appellants.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Cueiam,
The affidavits of service as originally filed were proper and correct and therefore we need not reach the question whether the court below erred in permitting appellees to amend.
Orders affirmed.
opinions.author: Pee Cueiam,

attorneys: Edward Kassab, with him Kassab, Cherry, Curran and Archbold, for appellants.
casebody.head_matter:
Drass et al. v. Tall Cedars Marina, Inc. et al., Appellants.
Argued May 5, 1970.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeeoy, JJ.
Edward Kassab, with him Kassab, Cherry, Curran and Archbold, for appellants.
Robert F. Jackson, for appellees.
October 9, 1970:
